caption.title: Summary description of alternative vector-control tools, primary challenges, and benefits to include probability of mitigating evolutionary response/impact in resistance management.

tr.th: Intended application in operational deployment; primary challenge to success; primary benefit of operational deployment
Impact in resistance management based on MoA

tr.td: Outdoors in immature habitats; presence of cryptic habitats; traditional deployment strategy
Outdoors in immature habitats; presence of cryptic habitats; traditional deployment strategy/aerial spray
Indoors and outdoors; lethal effects to nontargets; can be applied on various surfaces
Passive emanator to reduce humanâˆ’vector contact
Indoors and outdoors; resistance to currently available actives; can be delivered using consumer-product channels
Dependent on target site of actives
Captures and removes host seeking and/or gravid females
Indoors and outdoors; bulk; affordable and easy to use
Dependent on target site of actives
Attract and kill females and males (of all physiological status)
Outdoors; lethal effects to nontargets; easy to use
Dependent on target site of actives
Clothing, blankets, screens, curtains with insecticides or spatial repellents
Indoors and outdoors; acceptability/behavior change by end-user; mobile technology
Dependent on target site of actives
Release of radiated sterile male insects to sterilize females
Indoors and outdoors; colony maintenance, multiple releases, mating competitiveness; no nontarget effects
Release of transgenic insects with dominant lethal construct to eliminate female progeny production
Indoors and outdoors; colony maintenance, multiple releases; no nontarget effects
Indoors and outdoors; colony maintenance, multiple releases, mating competitiveness; regulations for release
Indoors and outdoors; colony maintenance, multiple releases, mating competitiveness; no nontarget effects
Population replacement (introduction and spread of pathogen effector gene)
Indoors and outdoors; off-target effects (molecular); rate of spread through population
Population suppression (introduction and spread of lethal gene)
Indoors and outdoors; off-target effects (molecular); rate of spread through population

fn.p: 1Primary Entomological MoA: S, population suppression; R, population replacement; L, reduction of mosquito longevity and density; C, reduction of human-vector contact.

Abbreviations: ATSB, attractant toxic sugar baits; CI, cytoplasmic incompatibility; IGR, insect growth regulators; ITM, insecticide-treated materials; MoA, mode of action; RIDL, release of insects with dominant lethality; SIT, sterile insect technique.
